docs.text: i don't appreciate it when a thriller manipulates the viewer into thinking the plot is interesting , when in fact it's ludicrous .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: in the case of the general's daughter , the plot is more than capable of intriguing you to a certain point .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: but at this juncture in the story , the movie begins to fall apart like a crumbling cookie .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: this predictable summer thriller is only sporadically involving , and that is unfortunately not enough to compensate for all of it's detailed flaws .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: get past one moment early on where john travolta exercises his southern accent , and you're likely to survive this entire movie .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: travolta plays criminal investigations divisions officer paul brenner , who's working undercover at a military base when another situation arises : the apparent rape and murder of a young female officer ( leslie stefanson ) .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it turns out that the victim is the daughter of general joe campbell ( james cromwell ) .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: let the investigation begin .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: with the assistance of fellow cid investigator sarah sunhill ( played rather on-the-sidelines by madeleine stowe ) , brenner uncovers what appears to be an intricate and bizarre homicide case .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: things begin to get marginally engrossing when we meet colonel moore ( james woods ) , a former commanding officer of the deceased who has a few secrets up his sleeve .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: woods submits another scene-stealing performance here as he oozes authority , surrounded by clouds of smoke emitted from his cigar .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: with echoes of his supporting role in true crime , in which he duked it out with clint eastwood in enjoyably profane verbal exchanges , he makes every moment believable .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: here though , the intense dialogue comes care of confrontations with travolta , as the two send mindful , knowing glares across the room .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: there are many scenes such as this in the general's daughter , in which the veteran cast performs splendidly under pressure , but the circumstances that tie these meetings together are difficult to absorb .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: director simon west ( con air ) , shows a watchful eye of delivering a stylish looking thriller , but he fails miserably when it comes to the intellectual part of it .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the general's daughter is , more often than not , a predictable and unexciting mess .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it does not help matters that the plot is virtually actionless , dragging it's heels all the way at a mind-numbing snails pace .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: a few brief action scenes , marvelously handled in the editing department , show that the movie could have delivered such a more proficient package .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: from a director who does such a great job of staging explosions and miraculous stunts , i suggest west should stick with mindless , rip-roaring action features and attempt to avoid future projects like this .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: still , the movie is certainly not without it's merits .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the acting is very good from the majority of the experienced cast .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the performances range from commanding ( travolta ) to electric ( woods ) to stiff-as-a-board ( cromwell , who doesn't show off his real talents here ) .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: madeleine stowe manages to hold her own for a while , but as the female lead in an action-thriller , she doesn't pull through sufficiently .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: one of the problems with the execution is that it's very predictable .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: >from minute one , i had few doubts about the identity of the killer in question .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the script even unwillingly points him out for us , using familiar techniques to hide his guilt until the unmasking toward the end .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: in all fairness , we've seen many of the devices used in the general's daughter put to greater effect in other films .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the secrets behind the girl's mysterious death are explained gradually , but by the resolution we have tunneled through so much malarkey that it feels unnecessary and surprisingly silly .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the general's daughter is not a terrible movie , and it is involving enough to sustain a viewer's attention span for a certain period of time .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: but it just could have been so much better .
docs.label: negative
